text:
go for it! (It's hard as nails though)

If you can't find it, feel free to pirate it. If you like it, and have a 3DS, you can buy Etrian Odyssey 4. (Only advocating piracy because I honestly think it's OK to pirate hard or impossible to get games. They're meant to be enjoyed after all.)

author: Raghnal

text: That's no problem... you enjoyed your time with the games correct?  Enjoyment means you didn't waste your time.  That, contrary to popular belief, is what life is all about.  Enjoying it while it lasts.  Do what you love.
author: weglarz

text: I know this is an old comment, but I couldn't agree more. Like, I always feel bad about playing video games for too long if I don't have anything else to take care of, but that is something I keep forgetting. Life really is about finding what you enjoy, and having no regrets after. You know, as long as it doesn't hurt yourself or anyone else.

author: oisin kelly

text:
That's basically what it was.

If 1F-15F were a giant forest/tower/tree, Cherry Tree Bridge is the top of that tree.  It seems to be a combination of floating islands and the few remaining branches of the tree that reach so high up.

author: Sephiko

text: I definitely know what you mean. That's how it was for me at some point, but I learned to focus and enjoy the games I'm playing without even thinking about the other ones I want to play after. You know there's a problem when you just started playing a game and you just want to finish it quick so you can play another one. ;)

text:

I hate how my mind thinks of gaming as work on a to do list...I wish I was a kid again.
